abstract: The Canadian lender Toronto-Dominion Bank agreed on Thursday to buy the parent company of Epoch Investment Partners for $668 million, as it moved to bolster its asset management operations in the United States.
snippet: The Canadian lender Toronto-Dominion Bank agreed on Thursday to buy the parent company of Epoch Investment Partners for $668 million, as it moved to bolster its asset management operations in the United States.
lead_paragraph: The Canadian lender Toronto-Dominion Bank agreed on Thursday to buy the parent company of Epoch Investment Partners for $668 million, as it moved to bolster its asset management operations in the United States.

headline.main: Toronto-Dominion to Buy Epoch for $668 Million

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: A stable of local restaurateurs are being periodically invited to set up shop at financial firms like Goldman Sachs, Bank of America, Deutsche Bank and Credit Suisse.
snippet: A stable of local restaurateurs are being periodically invited to set up shop at financial firms like Goldman Sachs, Bank of America, Deutsche Bank and Credit Suisse.
lead_paragraph: After leaving Wall Street more than four years ago, David Kostman recently returned.

headline.main: Local Restaurateurs Feed Wall Street’s Hungry Deal Makers
headline.print_headline: Local Restaurateurs Feed Wall Street’s Hungry Deal Makers
